intro: Aloe fievetii subsp. johannis-baptistei, commonly known as the Johann Baptist aloe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating, which helps it store water. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing yellow to orange flowers, which attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and resilient choice for succulent gardens.
